chefBio: Chef Apple Khan is a renowned chef who specializes in traditional Bengali cuisine. With over 10 years of experience in the culinary industry, she has created over 50 unique Bengali dishes that have earned her a loyal following.

recipes.name: Shorshe Ilish
recipes.cookingMethod: Marinate the fish with salt and turmeric powder. Make a paste of mustard seeds, green chilies, and salt. Fry the fish lightly in mustard oil, then add the mustard paste and some water. Cook until the gravy thickens.

recipes.name: Chingri Macher Malai Curry
recipes.cookingMethod: Fry the onion until it turns brown. Add ginger and garlic paste, then fry for a few more minutes. Add prawns and fry for a few more minutes. Add coconut milk and cook until the gravy thickens.

recipes.name: Bhapa Chingri
recipes.cookingMethod: Marinate the prawns with salt and turmeric powder. Grind coconut and green chilies to make a paste. Mix the paste with the prawns. Steam for 15-20 minutes.

chefBio: Chef Maria Begum is a rising star in the culinary world, known for her modern interpretations of traditional Bengali dishes. With 5 years of experience in the industry, she has already created 20 unique dishes that showcase her creativity and passion for cooking.

recipes.name: Bhuna Khichuri
recipes.method:
1. Wash the rice and lentils together and soak for 30 minutes.
2. Heat oil in a pressure cooker and fry onions until golden brown.
3. Add ginger and fry for a few seconds.
4. Add potatoes and fry for a few minutes.
5. Add the soaked rice and lentils to the cooker.
6. Add water and salt and pressure cook for 2-3 whistles.
7. Serve hot with fried eggplant or any vegetable of your choice.

recipes.name: Kosha Mangsho
recipes.cookingMethod: 1. Heat mustard oil in a pressure cooker and fry the onions till golden brown. 2. Add ginger, garlic, and green chilies and fry for a minute. 3. Add cumin and coriander powder and fry for 2-3 minutes. 4. Add the mutton and fry till it changes color. 5. Add chopped tomatoes and fry for 2-3 minutes. 6. Add salt, chili powder, turmeric, and garam masala and fry for another 2-3 minutes. 7. Add 2 cups of water and pressure cook till the mutton is tender. 8. Serve hot with steamed rice.

recipes.name: Bengali Fish Fry
recipes.cookingMethod: 1. Clean and wash the fish and marinate with turmeric, chili powder, cumin, coriander, ginger, garlic, lemon juice, and salt for 30 minutes. 2. Heat mustard oil in a pan and fry the fish till golden brown. 3. Serve hot with onion rings and lemon wedges.
